clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of PT010, PT009 and PT003 in Subjects With Moderate to Very Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, 52-Week, Chronic-Dosing, Multi-Center Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of PT010, PT009 and PT003 in Subjects With Moderate to Very Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of PT010, PT009 and PT003 in Subjects with Moderate to Very Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

detailed_description.textblock: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group, 52-Week, Chronic-Dosing, Multi-Center Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability of PT010, PT009 and PT003 in Subjects with Moderate to Very Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in BMD of the Lumbar Spine
primary_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in BMD of the lumbar spine T-Score at Week 52.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the LOCS III (P) Score at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the LOCS III (P) score (Severity of Posterior Subcapsular Cataract) at Week 52. P score is reported as a decimalized scale ranging from 0.1 (indicating a completely clear or colorless lens) to 5.9 (indicating complete opacification on the posterior capsule). A negative change in P score indicates an improvement and a positive change indicates a deterioration of LOCS III. A change in P score within 0.5 is an acceptable variation margin.

arm_group.description: Budesonide, Glycopyrronium, and Formoterol Fumarate (BGF) metered dose inhaler (MDI) (PT010, BGF MDI)
Glycopyrronium and Formoterol Fumarate (GFF) metered dose inhaler (MDI) (PT003, GFF MDI)
Budesonide and Formoterol Fumarate (BFF) metered dose inhaler (MDI) (PT009, BFF MDI)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Given their signed written informed consent to participate. Must have agreed to participate in and complete the lead-in Study PT010006.(NCT02497001)
Exclusion Criteria:
Severe osteoporosis Unable to achieve an acceptable DEXA scan Inability to achieve pupil dilation to at least 6 mm Subjects with an implanted artificial intraocular lens or are scheduled to undergo cataract surgery

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study randomized subjects at 69 sites in the United States from September 2015 to September 2017. The entire study period was scheduled to take up to approximately 58 weeks for each individual subject from the time of screening through the follow-up period.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were randomized in a 2:2:1 scheme (BGF MDI:GFF MDI:BFF MDI).

group.title: BGF MDI 320/14.4/9.6 ug
group.description: Budesonide Gylcopyrronium and Formoterol Fumarate Inhalation Aerosol 320/14.4/9.6 ug

group.description: Budesonide and Formoterol Fumarate Inhalation Aerosol 320/9.6 ug

baseline.population: The Safety Population included only subjects who signed ICF for Study PT010008 and received any amount of study drug (other than Symbicort).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in BMD of the Lumbar Spine
outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in BMD of the lumbar spine T-Score at Week 52.
outcome.population: BMD Population was defined as all evaluable subjects in the Safety Population who had a baseline BMD assessment and at least 1 on-treatment BMD assessment. Subjects were analyzed according to actual study drug received.

group.title: BGF MDI 320/14.4/9.6 ug

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in BMD of the Lumbar Spine
measure.description: Percent change from baseline in BMD of the lumbar spine T-Score at Week 52.
measure.population: BMD Population was defined as all evaluable subjects in the Safety Population who had a baseline BMD assessment and at least 1 on-treatment BMD assessment. Subjects were analyzed according to actual study drug received.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the LOCS III (P) Score at Week 52
outcome.description: Change from baseline in the LOCS III (P) score (Severity of Posterior Subcapsular Cataract) at Week 52. P score is reported as a decimalized scale ranging from 0.1 (indicating a completely clear or colorless lens) to 5.9 (indicating complete opacification on the posterior capsule). A negative change in P score indicates an improvement and a positive change indicates a deterioration of LOCS III. A change in P score within 0.5 is an acceptable variation margin.
outcome.population: Ophthalmologic Population was defined as all evaluable subjects in the Safety Population who had a baseline ophthalmologic assessment and at least 1 on-treatment ophthalmologic assessment. Subjects were analyzed according to actual study drug received.

group.title: BGF MDI 320/14.4/9.6 ug

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the LOCS III (P) Score at Week 52
measure.description: Change from baseline in the LOCS III (P) score (Severity of Posterior Subcapsular Cataract) at Week 52. P score is reported as a decimalized scale ranging from 0.1 (indicating a completely clear or colorless lens) to 5.9 (indicating complete opacification on the posterior capsule). A negative change in P score indicates an improvement and a positive change indicates a deterioration of LOCS III. A change in P score within 0.5 is an acceptable variation margin.
measure.population: Ophthalmologic Population was defined as all evaluable subjects in the Safety Population who had a baseline ophthalmologic assessment and at least 1 on-treatment ophthalmologic assessment. Subjects were analyzed according to actual study drug received.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the time of administration of the first dose of study drug to the time of the final follow-up telephone call. Serious Adverse events were collected from the time subject signed Informed Consent to the time of the final follow-up telephone call up to approximately 54 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The Safety Population was defined as all subjects who were randomized to treatment and received at least 1 dose of the study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Drafts of any and all publications or presentations of this study must be submitted at least 30 days prior to submission for publication or presentation to Pearl Therapeutics for review, approval, and to ensure consistency. Pearl Therapeutics has the right to request appropriate modification to correct facts and to represent it's opinions, or the opinions of the publication committee, if these differ with the proposed publication.
